abstract: A rights group says the retailer's aggressive efforts to keep out labor unions violated federal law and infringed on its workers’ rights.
snippet: A rights group says the retailer's aggressive efforts to keep out labor unions violated federal law and infringed on its workers’ rights.
lead_paragraph: In its first study of how an American company treats its workers, Human Rights Watch asserted yesterday that Wal-Mart’s aggressive efforts to keep out labor unions often violated federal law and infringed on its workers’ rights.
